Extract Urban Area from MODIS Land Cover (MCD12Q1.061)

Source: R/l4h_urban_area.R
l4h_urban_area.Rd

Extracts the annual area of a specific land cover class from the MODIS Land Cover product (MCD12Q1.061), using the specified land cover classification scheme (band).

Usage

l4h_urban_area(
  from,
  to,
  region,
  scale = 500,
  lc_band = "LC_Type2",
  sf = TRUE,
  quiet = FALSE,
  force = FALSE,
  ...
)

Arguments

from

Character string indicating the starting year (e.g., "2010").

to

Character string indicating the ending year (e.g., "2020").

region

A sf object representing the region of interest.

scale

Numeric. The nominal scale in meters to use for the area calculation (e.g., 500).

lc_band

Character. The MODIS land cover classification band to use. One of: "LC_Type1" (default), "LC_Type2", "LC_Type3", "LC_Type4", or "LC_Type5".

sf

Logical. Return result as an sf object? Default is TRUE.

quiet

Logical. If TRUE, suppress the progress bar (default FALSE).

force

Logical. Force request extract.

...

arguments of ee_extract of rgee packages.

Value

A tibble containing the year and area (in km²) of the selected land cover class.

Details

This function uses the MODIS Land Cover Type Yearly Global 500m dataset (MCD12Q1.061) from Google Earth Engine. It calculates the area of the land cover class "13" (Urban and Built-Up Lands) based on the selected band.

Available Classification Schemes:

  • LC_Type1: IGBP global vegetation classification (17 classes)

  • LC_Type2: University of Maryland (UMD) land cover classification

  • LC_Type3: MODIS LAI/FPAR Biome Type classification

  • LC_Type4: MODIS Net Primary Production (NPP) Biome classification

  • LC_Type5: Plant Functional Type (PFT) classification

Note: The function currently extracts only class 13 (Urban), which may correspond to different meanings depending on the selected lc_band.

For detailed class definitions of each scheme, refer to: MODIS/061/MCD12Q1 on Google Earth Engine

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{

library(land4health)
library(geoidep)
ee_Initialize()
region <- get_districts()
region_ee <- pol_as_ee(region, id = 'distr' ,simplify = 1000)
data <- get_urban(from = 2008, to = 2010, region = region)

} # }
